column1: Although Greece (or Hel´las) is only half as large as the State of New York
column2: it holds a very important place in the history of the world. It is situated in the southern part of Europe
column3: cut off from the rest of the continent by a chain of high mountains which form a great wall on the north. It is surrounded on nearly all sides by the blue waters of the Mediterranean Sea
column4: which stretch so far inland that it is said no part of the country is forty miles from the sea
column5: or ten miles from the hills. Thus shut in by sea and mountains
column6: it forms a little territory by itself
column7: and it was the home of a noted people.The history of Greece goes back to the time when people did not know how to write
column8: and kept no record of what was happening around them. For a long while the stories told by parents to their children were the only information which could be had about the country and its former inhabitants; and these stories
column9: slightly changed by every new teller
column10: grew more and more extraordinary as time passed.
